clinical_study.brief_title: Aquatic and Land Exercises in Chronic Low Back Pain
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Aquatic and Land Exercises on Pain, Health Related Quality of Life, Kinesiophobia and Disability in Chronic Low Back Pain

brief_summary.textblock: Aquatic and Land Exercises on Chronic Low Back Pain

detailed_description.textblock: The Effect of Aquatic and Land Exercises on Pain, Health Related Quality of Life, Kinesiophobia and Disability in Chronic Low Back Pain

primary_outcome.measure: pain in low back pain after aqua and land exercises
primary_outcome.description: It is asked to mark pain on a 10 cm scale.Pain was assessed at rest and at movement by using a 10-cm-long visual (0 cm means no pain while 10 cm means worst pain

primary_outcome.measure: quality of life after aqua and land exercises
primary_outcome.description: Quality of life was assessed by Short-Form 36 Health Survey (SF-36) High scores indicate good quality of life and low scores represent poor quality of life.

secondary_outcome.measure: disability in low back paitients after aqua and land exercise
secondary_outcome.description: .For disability assessment, the Modified Oswestry Disability İndex was used . According to the sum of scale; 0-4 points were considered as no disability, 5-14 points were mild, 15-24 points were moderate, 25-34 points were serious, and 35-50 points were fully functional inadequacy.

secondary_outcome.measure: kinesiophobia in low back paitients after aqua and land exercise
secondary_outcome.description: The assessment of kinesiophobia was made with the Tampa Scale The fact that the individual got a high score from the questionnaire shows that she has more fear of movement.

arm_group.arm_group_label: The Effect of Aquatic Exercises on Pain, quality of life
arm_group.description: Water-based exercise program was conducted in the second group of 15 patients in an indoor swimming pool. Temperature of mineral water was 36 °C. The program included warming up by walking forwards, sideways and backwards through the water in the pool; active range of motion of the joints of the lower extremities; stretching lower extremities; strengthening exercises for hips, knees, arms, elbows and wrists; and cooling down (slow walking, squatting and standing).

arm_group.arm_group_label: The Effect of Land Exercises on Pain, Quality of life
arm_group.description: Land-based exercise program included abdominal and back strengthening exercises.

intervention.arm_group_label: The Effect of Aquatic Exercises on Pain, quality of life
The Effect of Land Exercises on Pain, Quality of life

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients had to be diagnosed with clinical examination and radiological findings of low back pain from at least 6 months.
Exclusion Criteria:
- acute pain
